item.title: Laser Cut Dollar Sculptures by Scott Campbell
item.description:
Laser Cut Dollar Sculptures by Scott Campbell

Artist Scott Campbell uses a laser cutter to carve astonishing sculptures out of US dollars. The intricate designs found in many of his sculptures hint at his other occupation-tattoo artist & owner of Saved Tattoo in Brooklyn. via Gaks Designs & Hi-Fructose photos via Scott Campbell

item.title: Cakes With Teeth by Scott Hove
item.description:
Cakes With Teeth by Scott Hove

Oakland-based artist Scott Hove has created cake sculptures complete with gaping toothy mouths as part of his upcoming "Your Deadly Desserts" show at Modern Eden in San Francisco, October 8 to November 4. via Hi Fructose photos via Hi Fructose

item.title: Circuit Board Health Monitoring Tech Tattoos Are Already Here
item.description:
Circuit Board Health Monitoring Tech Tattoos Are Already Here

Ben Lamm, CEO of Chaotic Moon, is understandably excited while talking about his company's innovation. Dubbed 'Tech Tats', the tattoo kit, now in the prototype stage, will collect and transmit data similar to the Jawbone or Apple Watch. The tattoo, which washes off, will send data to medical staff and can also have military applications.

item.title: Escher in Motion
item.description:
Escher in Motion

Animation by Glenn Marshall. Music - 'Diva' by Jean Michel Jarre (feat. Laurie Anderson). www.butterfly.ie

item.title: The Space Doctor's Big Idea - The New Yorker
item.description:
The Space Doctor's Big Idea - The New Yorker

There once was a doctor with cool white hair. He was well known because he came up with some important ideas. He didn't grow the cool hair until after he was done figuring that stuff out, but by the time everyone realized how good his ideas were, he had grown the hair, so that's how everyone pictures him.

item.title: MECHANICAL TECHNO DEMONSTRATION
item.description:
MECHANICAL TECHNO DEMONSTRATION

Mechanical Techno Demonstration by Graham Dunning Video produced by Michael Forrest. Made at Lime Wharf Machines Room as part of Rhythm & Drone // Research & Development residency, September 2015. https://rhythmanddrone.wordpress.com/ Supported using public funding by the National Lottery through Arts Council England
